definitions.definition: Not specifically religious ; lay or civil , as opposed to clerical ; profane .
Temporal ; worldly , or otherwise not based on something timeless .
Not bound by the vows of a monastic order .
Happening once in an age or century.
examples: The secular games of ancient Rome were held to mark the end of a saeculum and the beginning of the next.

definitions.definition: Continuing over a long period of time, long-term .
examples: The long-term growth in population and income accounts for most secular trends in economic phenomena.

definitions.definition: Relating to long-term non-periodic irregularities , especially in planetary motion or magnetic field.

main_definition: Not specifically religious ; lay or civil , as opposed to clerical ; profane .
secondary_definitions: Temporal ; worldly , or otherwise not based on something timeless .
( Christianity ) Not bound by the vows of a monastic order .
Happening once in an age or century.
Continuing over a long period of time, long-term .
( astrophysics , geology ) Relating to long-term non-periodic irregularities , especially in planetary motion or magnetic field.
